author: Staff Reporter
text:
Tension gripped MES Road in East Tambaram on Friday, as parents protested in front of CSI Corley Higher Secondary School against the corporal punishment meted out to a Class VII student.

They said the student had been beaten up by his teacher at the school after he had failed to perform well in his academics.

Slogans raised

Over 50 parents gathered in front of the school and shouted slogans and urged the school authorities to take stern action against the teacher, who was involved in this.

The boy had a swelling on his hand and was down with severe fever, according to his father. He alleged that the school authorities were reluctant to act, when he complained to them.

Police officials pacified the protesters and school officials said they had suspended the teacher concerned for three days.

Following this assurance, the protesters dispersed, said a police official.

title: Protest over corporal punishment
